error.insufficientRights: No tiene suficientes privilegios para esta acción.

elements.checksumAlert: Esta dirección luce válida, pero no tiene algunos mecanismos de seguridad que lo protegerán de errores de tipeo, así que verifique que sea correcta. Si se encuentra, verifique que el ícono de seguridad sea el mismo.
elements.identiconHelper: Este es un ícono de seguridad, si la dirección cambia en lo más mínimo, el ícono será completamente distinto

texts.connectionErrorMist:
No se pudo conectar. Por favor, inicie geth con:

__node__

Asegúrese de establecer la ruta de IPC a la por defecto, cuando usa un datadir distinto, por ej.
geth --datadir ... --ipcpath /Users/<suUsuario>/Library/Ethereum/geth.ipc
o
geth --datadir ... --ipcpath /Users/<suUsuario>/.ethereum/geth.ipc.

Opcionalmente: --unlock <suCuenta>.
texts.connectionErrorBrowser:
No se pudo conectar. Por favor inicie geth con las siguientes opciones:

__node__

Opcionalmente agregue: --unlock <suCuenta>.
texts.testnetExplain: You are on a testnet, DO NOT SEND any real ether to these addresses

noAccounts.title: You have no accounts yet
noAccounts.text: You need to create at least one account with a strong password.

error.wrongChain: You seem on a different chain, please restart the Ethereum Wallet App!

warnings.txOriginVulnerabilityWallet: Esta cartera tiene contrato inteligente código obsoleto y está sujeto a ataques de phishing.
warnings.txOriginVulnerabilityCallToAction: Actualizar su contrato ahora y transferir todos sus fondos a su nueva.
warnings.txOriginVulnerabilityAccount: Esta cuenta es un propietario de un contrato cartera vulnerables y el uso de esta cuenta en los contratos maliciosos pueden poner en peligro sus fondos carteras. Actualizar su cartera antes de realizar cualquier transacción con esta cuenta.
warnings.txOriginVulnerabilityPopup: Encontramos carteras vulnerables! Asegúrese de implementar las nuevas carteras y mover los fondos!
warnings.learnMore: Más información acerca de esta vulnerabilidad

testnetWallet.walletNeedsDeployment:
You seem to be on a testnet.

There is no original wallet contract code found, we need to deploy one, which can be used by the wallet contract stub contracts, from your address:

__account__

Please make sure this address has at least 1 ether!
testnetWallet.testnetWalletDeployed:
Original wallet contract deployed!
An original wallet contract was deployed on the address:

__address__.

interface.title: Contract JSON Interface
interface.description: If you want to have someone else execute this contract, send this information along with the contract's address.

accounts.title: Accounts Overview
accounts.accountNote: Accounts can't display incoming transactions, but can receive, hold and send ether. To see incoming transactions create a wallet contract to store ether.
accounts.walletNote: Most exchanges don't support receiving ether from a contract wallet yet. Be sure to move the money to an account address first!
accounts.qrCodeLabel: Point a compatible mobile app to this code
accounts.walletsDescription: These are contracts that are stored on the blockchain and can hold and secure ether. They can have multiple accounts as owners and keep a full log of all transactions.
accounts.walletsDescriptionNotEnoughFunds: Once you have more than 1 ether you can create a more sophisticated contracts. Wallets are one type of basic smart contract, that allows your funds to be controlled by multiple accounts and have an optional daily limit on withdrawals, to increase security. To create your own custom contracts go to the Contracts tab.
accounts.accountsDescription: Accounts are password protected keys that can hold ether, secure ethereum-based tokens or coins and control contracts. Accounts can't display incoming transactions.

modal.deleteText:
Do you really want to delete this wallet contract? The account will still exist on the blockchain, but
if you delete the address, you may not be able to find it and may lose access to the funds deposited

Type "delete" confirm the deletion.

backupWallet.title: Backup your wallet contract address!
backupWallet.description: Make sure to write down the wallet contract address:

transactions.outOfGasDesc: The transaction didn't seem to have enough gas to execute.

error.noDataDeployed: No data is deployed on the contract address!
error.outOfGas: The transaction from __from__ to __to__ couldn't be successfully executed.

simple.title: Single owner account
simple.description: A simple contract without additional security measures.
simple.warning: Note: If your owner account is compromised your wallet has no protection.

multisig.title: Multisignature wallet contract
multisig.description: A contract controlled by multiple accounts
multisig.text1: This is a joint account controlled by
multisig.text2: owners. You can send up to
multisig.text4: Any transaction over that daily limit requires the confirmation of

import.title: Import wallet
import.youreOwner: Your "__account__" account is an owner of this wallet contract.
import.watchOnly: You don't own the account, but you can add it as a "WATCH ONLY" account.
import.notWallet: This address has no wallet contract.

error.stubHasNoOrigWalletAddress: Your stub contract has no original account address set.  Please restart your App!
error.checkOwnerAddress: Please change the contract address __address__ to an account.

error.emptyWallet: The account you want to send from is empty.
error.notEnoughFunds: You don't have enough funds in the account.
error.noAmount: You didn't specify an amount to send.

texts.ownerPaysGas: Gas is paid by the owner of the wallet contract
texts.sendAmountEquivalent:
You want to send __amount__ in ether, using exchange rates from cryptocompare.com.
Which is currently an equivalent of __etherAmount__.
texts.overDailyLimit: This amount is over the remaining daily limit of __limit__ (of __total__ per day), so you need __count__ other account to confirm.
texts.overDailyLimit_plural: This amount is over the remaining daily limit of __limit__ (of __total__ per day), so you need __count__ other accounts to confirm.
texts.underDailyLimit: This amount is under the remaining daily limit of __limit__ (of __total__ per day), means it will send immediately.
texts.sendFee: This is the most amount of money that might be used to process this transaction. Your transaction will be mined __timetext__.
texts.noCodeInRecipient: The recipient account is not a contract, so you can't execute anything. Put a contract address on the 'TO' field.
texts.addData: You can add extra data to send along with your transaction. If you leave the "to" field empty it will try to deploy a contract from your data.
texts.dataNotExecutable: We aren't able to execute this data.  This means this transaction will use all the gas you provide.
texts.cantEstimateGas: We can't estimate your gas usage properly, as you need at least 1 ether in your account.

timeTexts.0: in a few minutes or more

tokens.title: Custom Tokens
tokens.subTitle: Added tokens
tokens.description: Tokens are currencies and other fungibles built on the Ethereum platform. In order for accounts to watch for tokens and send them, you have to add their address to this list. You can create your own token by simply modifiying this example of a custom token contract or learning more about Ethereum Tokens.
tokens.deleteToken: Do you want to remove the token __token__ from your list?

contracts.description: In order to watch and interact with a contract already deployed on the blockchain you need to know its address and description of its interface in JSON format.
contracts.name: Contract Name
contracts.noContract:
Put the source of the contract you want here. You can find many examples of contracts at the ethereum.org:

  • Build a token
  • Start a crowdsale
  • Create a blockchain organization

error.noDataProvided: No data found: select a contract from the 'select contract' menu
